application.name: deltadays
application.description: prints the number of days in a date range

details.item: start and end dates may be provided as trailing arguments instead of using -s and -e.

application.example: set_dates weekly dt_files=`findfiles -d $dt_dir -s $startdate -e $enddate -g "Activity_${spot_id}_*.log.gz"` n_dates=`deltadays $startdate $enddate` n_files=`echo $dt_files | wc -w` if [ $n_dates -gt $n_files ]; then warn "missing input files." exit 2 fi
